title: Andy Cole urges Manchester United's Marcus Rashford to settle on his strongest position
text:
Manchester United legend Andy Cole has urged Marcus Rashford to settle on his strongest position.

Rashford, who has scored three goals so far this season, has received a considerable amount of criticism for some of his recent performances.

The 21-year-old is capable of playing up front or on either flank, but Cole believes that if Rashford is to push on he has to be regularly deployed in one position.

Manchester United legend Andy Cole has urged Marcus Rashford to settle on his best position

Cole told The Sun: 'He doesn't really enjoy it with his back to goal and he wants to pick it up and run at the defender.

'He is a super talent but he has to decide now what he wants to be.

'Does he want to be a goalscorer or does he want to play off the left or right?

'He's 21 so I'd like to believe he knows what his strongest position is.'

Rashford, who has struggled for form, is capable of playing up front or on either flank

Cole suggested that Rashford needs to start becoming more prolific in front of goal for United

MARCUS RASHFORD'S RECORD FOR MANCHESTER UNITED Centre-forward: 106 games, 37 goals, 15 assists Left winger: 55 games, 13 goals, 11 assists Right winger: 17 games, one goal, two assists Second striker/attacking midfielder: Three games

Rashford has 48 goals in 179 appearances for United and Cole feels that the England international needs to be more prolific.

Cole said: 'But if you are going to play as a centre forward for Manchester United, you have got to be looking to get yourself 20 goals.

'His best return in a season so far is 13 and if that is your best return, and you are the main striker, you are going to have to get yourself a few more.'

Despite his recent difficulties at club level, Rashford has retained his place in the England squad for the upcoming games against Czech Republic and Bulgaria.

With United having sold Romelu Lukaku to Inter Milan in the summer, Rashford is likely to continue to be used as United's main striker for the time being.

United, who are in 10th place in the Premier League, return to action on Sunday when they face Newcastle away.
description: Manchester United legend Andy Cole has urged Marcus Rashford to settle on his strongest position. The 21-year-old is capable of playing up front or on either flank.
